inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: The duration of the research is 25 months (24 months for patient)

inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: She is a 42 year-old postmenopausal woman

inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: The number of patients required in this multicentric and prospective study is 240 (16 participating centers)

inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: Sentinel lymph node assessment (SLN) was developed to select patients likely not to have axillary node extension using a technique less invasive than conventional dissection.

inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: This technique allows an optimization of histopathological analysis: the pathologist must analyze only two nodes on average (instead of 10-15)

inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: The principal indicators of success for the technique are the detection rate, the false negative rate and the number of SLN sampled.

inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: A homogeneous technique with 'combined', colorimetric and isotopic SLN detection with subareolar or peri-tumoral injection will be used

inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: The histopathological procedure will also be homogeneous, and validated within the group of pathologists of the Fédération Nationale des Centres de Lutte Contre le Cancer (FNCLCC)

inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: She had a screening sonogram which revealed an abnormality in the right breast. Core biopsy was done and revealed a 1.8 cm infiltrating ductal breast carcinoma in the left upper outer quadrant

exclusion.label: met
exclusion.evidence: She had a screening sonogram which revealed an abnormality in the right breast. Core biopsy was done and revealed a 1.8 cm infiltrating ductal breast carcinoma in the left upper outer quadrant

exclusion.label: met
exclusion.evidence: Core biopsy was done and revealed a 1.8 cm infiltrating ductal breast carcinoma in the left upper outer quadrant

notes: The patient is a postmenopausal woman with a history of breast cancer and is undergoing treatment. She has no palpable masses on breast exam.
